title: Le Minh Phuong
text:
About me
I am a Vietnamese fourth year PhD student in development economics at the Université Paris-1 Panthéon-Sorbonne, under the supervision of Mohamed Ali Marouani ; and a part-time Attaché Temporaire d’Enseignement et de Recherche (ATER) at IEDES (Paris-1).

My research interests lie in the areas of inequality, crises, and firms productivity. I am passionate about understanding the economic dynamics that shape the livelihoods of individuals and communities, and strive to contribute to the development of policies that foster inclusive growth and reduce poverty.
Through my research, I aim to generate new insights and knowledge that can inform policy-making and improve the well-being of people in developing countries. Thank you for visiting my page and I hope you find my research and experiences informative


Research Interests

Inequality
Crises (Covid, Tunisian Revolution)
Firms’ productivity



Education
Panthéon-Sorbonne University                            Paris, France  
PhD in Economics                                                    2019 -  
Advisor: Mohamed Ali Marouani
Dissertation : “Exploring the Interplay of Productivity and Inequality in times of Crises: The Cases of Tunisia and Vietnam”
Panthéon-Sorbonne University                            Paris, France  
Master 2                                                                  2016 - 2017

title: Le Minh Phuong
text:
Welcome to my personal page!

I am a Vietnamese fourth year PhD student in development economics at the Université Paris-1 Panthéon-Sorbonne, under the supervision of Mohamed Ali Marouani ; and a part-time Attaché Temporaire enshrinement et de Recherche (ATER) at IEDES (Paris-1).

My research interests lie in the areas of inequality, crises, and firms productivity – with a focus on Tunisia and Vietnam. I am passionate about understanding the economic dynamics that shape the livelihoods of individuals and communities, and strive to contribute to the development of policies that foster inclusive growth and reduce poverty.
Through my research, I aim to generate new insights and knowledge that can inform policy-making and improve the well-being of people in developing countries. Thank you for visiting my page and I hope you find my research and experiences informative.

Welcome to my personal page!

I am a Vietnamese fourth year PhD student in development economics at the Université Paris-1 Panthéon-Sorbonne, under the supervision of Mohamed Ali Marouani ; and a part-time Attaché Temporaire enshrinement et de Recherche (ATER) at IEDES (Paris-1).

My research interests lie in the areas of inequality, crises, and firms productivity – with a focus on Tunisia and Vietnam. I am passionate about understanding the economic dynamics that shape the livelihoods of individuals and communities, and strive to contribute to the development of policies that foster inclusive growth and reduce poverty.
Through my research, I aim to generate new insights and knowledge that can inform policy-making and improve the well-being of people in developing countries. Thank you for visiting my page and I hope you find my research and experiences informative.

2022
